thread.title: Home searches, traffic stop lead to 4 Orange drug arrests, police announce
thread.title_full: Home searches, traffic stop lead to 4 Orange drug arrests, police announce

author: Staff Reports
title: Home searches, traffic stop lead to 4 Orange drug arrests, police announce
text:
Home searches, traffic stop lead to 4 Orange drug arrests, police announce
Published 3:29 pm Thursday, January 25, 2024
On Tuesday, Orange Police Department narcotics detectives were conducting surveillance in preparation for a search warrant.
During that time, detectives conducted a traffic stop on a Chevrolet Impala.
During that traffic stop, two subjects identified as Andrew Ardoin, 35, of Orange, and Tyrell Bird, 21, of Orange, were found in possession of methamphetamine and cocaine, Sergeant Isaac Henry said.
Ardoin and Bird were taken into custody.
A search warrant was then obtained and executed at 2801 Sunset Avenue, Apartment 69.
During the execution of that search warrant, additional methamphetamine and cocaine were discovered.
Samuel Ardoin, 23, of Orange, was also taken into custody.
All three subjects were arrested for possession of a controlled substance, (methamphetamine) felony 2 and possession of a controlled substance (cocaine) felony 2. All three were taken to the Orange County Jail and released to the on-duty staff.
The City of Orange Narcotic Division was assisted by the West Orange Police Department.
Earlier arrest
On Monday at 10:49 p.m., Orange Police Department narcotics detectives conducted a traffic stop on David Feathers, 30, of Orange.
Upon completion of the traffic stop, a search warrant was executed at 38 Bruce Lane due to an ongoing investigation into Feathers for selling narcotics from his residence.
During the search of the residence, police said detectives located more than an ounce of methamphetamine and more than an ounce of powder and crack cocaine.
Feathers was placed under arrest for possession of controlled substance (methamphetamine) felony 2, possession of controlled substance (cocaine) felony 2 and four active traffic warrants.
Feathers was taken to the Orange County Jail and released to the on-duty staff.
The City of Orange Narcotic Division was assisted by the West Orange Police Department.
